summary_points: 1. Vistra Corp. reported GAAP full-year 2024 Net Income of $2,812 million and Cash Flow from Operations of $4,563 million, exceeding the midpoint of its original 2024 guidance by $438 million for Ongoing Operations Adjusted FCFbG.

2.  Full-year 2024 Net Income increased by $1,320 million compared to full-year 2023, primarily due to unrealized mark-to-market gains on derivatives, the Energy Harbor acquisition, and increased revenues from estimated nuclear production tax credits.

3. Vistra reaffirmed its 2025 guidance ranges for Ongoing Operations Adjusted EBITDA ($5.5 billion to $6.1 billion) and Ongoing Operations Adjusted FCFbG ($3.0 billion to $3.6 billion), and anticipates a 2026 midpoint opportunity of more than $6,000 million for Ongoing Operations Adjusted EBITDA.
1. Viatris Inc. reported a US GAAP net loss of $(634) million for 2024, despite meeting its guidance for total revenues and exceeding it for free cash flow.
2.  Full-year 2024 total revenues were $14.7 billion, a 4% decrease year-over-year on a GAAP basis, primarily due to divestitures.

3. The FDA warning letter and import alert for Viatris' Indore facility are expected to negatively impact 2025 total revenues by approximately $500 million and adjusted EBITDA by approximately $385 million.
1. Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. reported record full-year 2024 revenue of $9.5 billion, an 11% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand despite only a 3% capacity growth.
2.  Full-year 2025 Adjusted EBITDA is projected to be approximately $2.72 billion, an 11% increase from 2024, but this includes ~$70 million in headwinds from foreign exchange and fuel.

3. Net leverage, while improved to 5.3x at the end of 2024 (a two-turn reduction from 2023), is expected to slightly increase to approximately 5.7x in the first quarter of 2025 due to a new ship delivery.

1. J.M. Smucker Co. reported a net loss per diluted share of $6.22 for the quarter ended January 31, 2025, primarily due to noncash impairment charges related to the Sweet Baked Snacks reporting unit.
2.  Compared to the prior year, cash provided by operations decreased by $167.1 million (from $406.5 million to $239.4 million) during the quarter ended January 31, 2025.

3. The company forecasts a 7.25% increase in net sales for the full fiscal year 2025, but comparable net sales are only expected to increase by approximately 0.75% due to divestitures and a decline in contract manufacturing sales.
1. Warner Bros. Discovery's total revenue decreased by 4% ex-FX for the full year 2024 compared to 2023.
2.  The Direct-to-Consumer segment is projected to generate $1.3 billion in Adjusted EBITDA in 2025.
3. Increased sports rights costs will negatively impact 2025 Adjusted EBITDA, with a reversal expected in 2026.

1. Teleflex Inc. announced on February 27, 2025, a proposed separation into two independent, publicly traded companies and an acquisition of substantially all of BIOTRONIK SE & Co. KG's Vascular Intervention business.
2.  Teleflex projects a 2025 GAAP revenue decline of -0.35% to 0.65%, despite a projected adjusted constant currency revenue growth of 1.00% to 2.00%.
3.  A $300 million accelerated share repurchase program will replace the existing $500 million program, starting February 28, 2025.
1. Evergy, Inc. reported full-year 2024 GAAP earnings per share (EPS) of $3.79, up from $3.17 in 2023, and adjusted (non-GAAP) EPS of $3.81, up from $3.54 in 2023.
2.  Evergy reaffirmed its 2025 GAAP and adjusted EPS guidance of $3.92 to $4.12 and expects adjusted EPS growth in the upper half of its 4% to 6% long-term annual target range starting in 2026.
3. The company increased its 2025-2029 capital investment plan to $17.5 billion.

1. BNY Mellon faces potential liabilities totaling approximately $219 million stemming from legal proceedings (including $150 million in German tax liability appeals and a $69 million potential loss from legal and regulatory matters).
2.  BNY Mellon's available-for-sale securities increased significantly year-over-year, rising by $11.2 billion to $88 billion as of December 31, 2024.
3.  Repatriation of $1.4 billion in foreign earnings could trigger a $170 million tax liability for BNY Mellon.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$641,677,014.21 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of February 26, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On February 26, 2025, 21,080,277 Class A shares and 10,400,407 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3.  News Corp’s future repurchases under the US$1 billion program are contingent on market conditions, the market price of the Company’s stock, and other factors.
1. Hormel Foods Corporation reported first-quarter fiscal 2025 net sales of $2.99 billion, representing a 1% increase in organic net sales compared to the same period in 2024.

2. Diluted earnings per share for the first quarter of 2025 were $0.31, down from $0.40 in the first quarter of 2024; however, adjusted diluted earnings per share were $0.35 compared to $0.41 in the same period of 2024.

3. The company reaffirmed its fiscal 2025 organic net sales growth outlook of 1% to 3%, but updated its diluted earnings per share expectations to $1.49 to $1.63 (previously $1.51 to $1.65) due to a $0.02 loss on the sale of a non-core sow operation.

1. On February 25, 2025, Super Micro Computer, Inc. regained compliance with Nasdaq listing rule 5250(c)(1) after resolving delays in filing its Q2 FY2025 10-Q, FY2024 10-K, and Q1 FY2025 10-Q reports.
2. The company's next Annual Meeting of Stockholders is scheduled for June 4, 2025, and the deadline for stockholder proposals is March 8, 2025.
3.  Stockholder proposals must comply with Delaware law, SEC rules, and the company's bylaws.
1. Healthpeak Properties, Inc. announced that its President and CEO, Scott Brinker, will present at the Citi 2025 Global Property CEO Conference on March 3, 2025.
2.  The filing is an 8-K Current Report, filed on February 26, 2025.
3. A replay of the presentation will be available on Healthpeak's website until March 3, 2026.
1. Timothy Murphy, Mastercard's Chief Administrative Officer, will transition to Vice Chair, and Richard Verma will succeed him as Chief Administrative Officer, effective May 1, 2025.
2.  The filing is an 8-K current report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3.  The filing includes no specific future impacts or risks with associated numbers.
1. On February 26, 2025, FedEx Corp. completed exchange offers and consent solicitations for various series of senior notes, retiring and canceling the accepted notes.
2.  A total of $10,724,846,000 in principal amount of USD notes and €939,697,000 in principal amount of Euro notes were tendered and accepted.

3. FedEx is obligated to pay additional interest on the new notes if a shelf registration statement (if required) is not declared effective by 180 days after the 365th day following the issuance of the notes (February 26, 2025).

1. NetApp, Inc. appointed Elizabeth O’Callahan as Executive Vice President, Chief Administrative Officer, and Secretary, effective March 3, 2025, expanding her responsibilities to include Human Resources, Workplace Experience, and Corporate Communications in addition to her existing roles.
2.  O’Callahan's annual base salary increased to $715,000 effective March 3, 2025, reflecting her expanded responsibilities.
3. The restructuring aims to foster greater synergy, alignment, and operational excellence within the company, supporting its corporate strategy.
1. On February 26, 2025, AbbVie Inc. completed a public offering of $4,000,000,000 in senior notes due between 2028 and 2055.
2. The offering comprised four tranches of senior notes with varying maturities and interest rates.
3. AbbVie has the option to redeem the notes before their maturity dates at a price specified in the indenture.
1. On February 24, 2025, Bill Wagner resigned from Akamai Technologies, Inc.'s Board of Directors to become CEO of Semrush Holdings, Inc.
2. The SEC filing is an 8-K form, indicating a current report.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned in the provided text.
